newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: RUGBY UNION-IRELAND'S CLOHESSY SIGNS CONTRACT WITH QUEENSLAND.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-IRELAND'S CLOHESSY SIGNS CONTRACT WITH QUEENSLAND.

text.p: Ireland tight-head prop Peter Clohessy said on Wednesday he had signed a five month contract with the Queensland Rugby Union in Australia.
Clohessy, 30, who has won 16 caps, will travel to Australia early next year.
He has been suspended until the end of November after a stamping incident in the Five Nations' match against France in February.
"I feel that if I did not go, I might subsequently regret it. I have great respect for Queensland coach John Connolly and look forward to playing under him," Clohessy said.
"I feel it will do me good to start again in a new environment. It has been hard to be out of the game since last February but I must put that behind me."
